[HERE COMES THE BUS®]
The Transportation Department is happy to remind you about the Here Comes the Bus application! This easy‐to‐use website and app enables you to see the location of your child’s school bus on a smartphone, tablet or personal computer. This way, you know when the bus is near your stop, so you can send your child out at the right time, or be ready for them to get off the bus.
Here Comes the Bus uses global positioning system (GPS) technology to locate and track your child’s school bus. It is also safe as it uses HTTPS, just like a bank or an online store, which means all communications between your web browser and the site is encrypted and secure. For more information or go to our website, www.edwardsburgpublicschools.org, click on the Departments and Services tab, and select the Transportation page for a link to the how‐to videos and more information about Here Comes the Bus! Visit this link: https://www.edwardsburgpublicschools.org/apps/pages/index.jsp?uREC_ID=787859&type=d&pREC_ID=1363731

This easy‐to‐use website and app enables you to see the location of your child’s school bus on a smartphone, tablet or personal computer. [Nurses Corner] National Nutrition Month - Snack Attack!
Try these healthy snacks to give your children the energy they need to play and do homework. Stock the kitchen – Whatever is in the house is what your children will eat – so shop with that in mind. Get interesting fruits and vegetables in different colors. Try mango or peach salsa, and let your child dip in veggie sticks. Stock air-pop. Offer choices of other healthy options.
Have a mini-meal – Breakfast or lunch foods can make a good snack. Oatmeal with bananas and cinnamon scrambled eggs in a pita pocket, whole wheat English muffins, etc. Build your own – Let you child get creative in the kitchen and they will be likely to eat the results. Make kebabs with fruit chunks and cheese cubes. Cut sandwiches with cookie cutters for fun shapes. Decorate apple slices with dried fruits, etc.

From Nutrition Nuggets 2018

post_text: Yellow Ribbon Suicide Prevention program – In February, the Yellow Ribbon Suicide Prevention Program visited our high school for a school-wide presentation. This program’s core concept is to empower youth (and adults who are involved with youth) in learning how to confront the issue of suicide and to be engaged in suicide prevention. The program teaches youth that it’s okay to "Ask 4 Help" and teaches the myths surrounding suicide, the warning signs, and what to do if you or a friend is depressed or thinking of suicide and much more. The program is designed in a way that reaches youth and effectively gets the message across. When you consider that 1 in 5 teens is thinking about suicide right now and that suicide is the 2nd leading cause of death for youth ages 14-24, the Yellow Ribbon Program is essential. Each student received an Ask4Help!® card and a rubber bracelet with the words "UR Not Alone" and the number for the National Crisis Hotline.

Eddies, stay home and stay healthy! See you back at school on Tuesday, February 11.

post_text: [HERE COMES THE BUS®] The Transportation Department is happy to remind you of the Here Comes the Bus application! This easy‐to‐use website and app enables you to see the location of your child’s school bus on a smartphone, tablet or personal computer. This way, you know when the bus is near your stop, so you can send your child out at the right time, or be ready for them to get off the bus. Here Comes the Bus uses a global positioning system (GPS) technology to locate and track your child’s school bus. It is also safe as it uses HTTPS, just like a bank or an online store, which means all communications between your web browser and the site is encrypted and secure. For more information or go to our Website, www.edwardsburgpublicschools.org, click on the Departments and Services tab and select the Transportation page for a link to how‐to videos and more information about Here Comes the Bus! Prospective volunteers will need to fill out a Confidential Volunteer Background Check form, which is available on the Edwardsburg Schools website at www.edwardsburgpublicschools.org. *YOU MUST SUBMIT A COPY OF YOUR DRIVER’S LICENSE WITH THE FORM* We are proud to have a strong volunteer program and are thankful for everyone who helps make our schools the best learning environment possible! #ProudToBeAnEdddie
